metadata.titel_preek: The Season of Epiphany: Mission and the Glory of Christ

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His glory through Jesus Christ to a fallen world, gathering a people (the harvest) and vanquishing evil to establish a perfected creation.

tekstueel_bewijs: He is gathering up all the works of the devil
He may be known, worshiped, and obeyed

object.identificatie: The salvation/transformation of humanity and the restoration of creation.
tekstueel_bewijs: the news of Jesus Christ... who takes the sin of the world
the perfected creation that is to come
Almighty God, whose Son our Savior...
the righteousness of God is a gift
giving angels charge... the fruitful ears to store
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the harvest being gathered).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word and Sacraments
tekstueel_bewijs: illumined by your Word and Sacraments
present in the power of the Holy Spirit
action of his Holy Spirit working through unearned gifts
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (Christ) and Helper (Spirit).
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power and active agent of transformation.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Works of the Devil
tekstueel_bewijs: works of the devil to be vanquished
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but 'powers and principalities' and 'the works of the devil' requiring divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church participates in the mission of Christ by proclaiming the Gospel to the nations.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Apostles
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Proclamation of the Word of life to the nations
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The mission of the church is explicitly founded upon and follows the primary mission of Jesus ('The proclamation of the mission of Jesus is the foundation of the mission of the church').

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Salvation/Restoration → The Nations
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → Jesus Christ ← The Devil/Sin

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus is gathering up all the works of the devil
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we see how we can begin to be transformed
the church has indeed abandoned its reason for being

voorbeelden: preaching of the gospel... must never take a back seat
the message... drove the apostles to preach
The season teaches us to value the entire fellowship
in him is divine creative power
his unique capacity to create new life even in people who might otherwise have resisted him

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's 'ability' (Power) to save and transform, rather than the hearer's 'obligation' (Duty). Grace is presented as the endowment of competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the threat of judgment (S2) and the failure of human effort (~S1) to the overwhelming power of Christ's grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes S2 (the fire/sin) upon himself to grant S1 to the 'chaff'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'great threshing floor' and 'fire' are used to establish the necessity of the Subject's action.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects 'Jesus as a figure to be emulated' (Moralism) in favor of 'Jesus as the unique Lamb of God' (Grace).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: mentioning heroic work by Christian groups

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is gathering up all the works of the devil
righteousness... is a gift and cannot be earned

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The text explicitly warns against viewing Jesus as merely a person to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus is the Subject who acts upon the disciples, not a model they copy by their own power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and worship; the burden of 'self-creation' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic emphasis on the power of the Word.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The secondary program (mission) is perfectly anchored in the primary program (Christ's power).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: gathering up all the works of the devil to be vanquished

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit bestows 'unearned and undeserved gifts' that transform the subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total. 'None is righteous' and all are 'chaff' without Christ.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (The Lord shall come and take his harvest home).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'engine' of the narrative is Christ's authority and creative power, not human effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids the trap of moralism by consistently making Jesus the Subject of the active verbs and the source of all competence.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'mission' theme, semiotics reveals that the 'mission' is actually Christ's action, not a human task.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Moves beyond the meaning of 'make disciples' to the structural reality of who is doing the making.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Helper' (Spirit) is not just a tool for the human subject, but the means by which the Divine Subject (Christ) reaches the Receiver.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (directed, said, came, takes, gathering, calls, befriends, bestows)
God (used, shall come, shall take, shall purge)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' effectively.
